required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optimisation of Disease Management in Patients With Epithelial Ovarian Cancer in France
clinical_study.official_title: Optimisation of Disease Management in Patients With Epithelial Ovarian Cancer in France

brief_summary.textblock:
No structured organization for ovarian first line management emerges in France. Management across France seems to depend on regional contexts.
Regions display no specific organization or delineate regional network for the ovarian cancer management or report centralized management revolving around referent centers. These different templates present a major problem in identifying differences, costs and benefit.
To deal with this issue the Investigators propose a health economic evaluation based on cost-effectiveness analyses, completed with a budget impact analysis. This study will investigate the cost-effective management of patients with initial ovarian cancer using databases representative of different parts of French territories.

primary_outcome.measure: Incremental cost-effectiveness ratio expressed in cost per relapse-free year gained
primary_outcome.description: To perform a cost-effectiveness analysis in order to evaluate the most efficient organization for ovarian cancer in 1st line ot treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Incremental cost-effectiveness ratio expressed in cost per QALY(Quality-Adjusted Life Year) gained.

secondary_outcome.description: Cost assessment performed retrospectively for each patient: hospital stays, visits and other health-related costs will be identified and measured based on the French national Health Insurance perspective. QALY (Quality-Adjusted Life Year)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: RFS will be assessed 2 years after diagnosis

study_pop.textblock: Women with ovarian epithelial cancer diagnosed in 2012

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ovarian epithelial cancer initially diagnosed in 2012
- Age > 18 years old
- Residency in France (Rhône-Alpes region, District of Calvados and Cotes d'Or)
- First-line ovarian epithelial cancer
Exclusion Criteria:
- Relapsed ovarian epithelial cancer
- Non epithelial ovarian cancer
